summary.span: 管理角色中的用户成员资格，以便在 ASP.NET 应用程序中进行授权检查。

span.span: Manages user membership in roles for authorization checking in an ASP.NET application.

summary.span: 此类不能被继承。

remarks.format: ## Remarks ASP.NET 角色管理，可管理你的应用程序基于组的用户，称为角色的授权。ASP.NET role management enables you to manage authorization for your application based on groups of users, referred to as roles. 通过将用户分配到角色，可以控制对不同的部分或功能的 Web 应用程序根据角色而不是，或扩充，访问指定基于用户名的授权。By assigning users to roles, you can control access to different parts or features of your Web application based on role instead of, or in addition to, specifying authorization based on user name. 例如，员工应用程序可能具有角色管理器、 员工、 控制器和等等，例如为每个角色都指定了不同的权限。For example, an employee application might have roles such as Managers, Employees, Directors, and so on, where different privileges are specified for each role. 用户可以属于多个角色。Users can belong to more than one role. 例如，如果您的网站是一个论坛，某些用户可能是角色的成员和版主。For example, if your site is a discussion forum, some users might be in the role of both Members and Moderators. 可以定义要在站点上，具有不同权限的每个角色，在这两个角色的用户就这两种权限集。You might define each role to have different privileges on the site, and a user who is in both roles would then have both sets of privileges. 若要启用角色管理 ASP.NET 应用程序，使用的元素`system.web`部分应用程序中，在 Web.config 文件中，如以下示例所示。To enable role management for your ASP.NET application, use the element of the `system.web` section in the Web.config file for your application, as shown in the following example. ``` ``` 在 Web 应用程序的配置文件中或以编程方式在代码中，可以指定授权规则。You can specify authorization rules in the configuration file for your Web application or programmatically in your code. 例如，Web.config 文件中的以下节要求用户 （通过拒绝匿名用户），登录，然后仅允许用户具有访问权限的管理员角色中。For example, the following section from a Web.config file requires users to log on (by denying anonymous users), and then allows only users in the Administrators role to have access. ``` ``` 如果使用`authorization`中应用程序的 Web.config 文件以指定基于应用程序的用户的角色的授权部分必须提供身份验证的用户标识。If you use the `authorization` section in your application's Web.config file to specify authorization based on roles, users of your application must supply an authenticated user identity. 您可以通过使用 Windows 或 Forms 身份验证对用户进行身份验证。You can authenticate users by using either Windows or Forms authentication. 无法将匿名用户分配到角色。Anonymous users cannot be assigned to a role. 独立于或与 ASP.NET 结合使用，可以使用角色类。Roles can be used independently of, or in conjunction with, the ASP.NET classes. 若要以编程方式验证角色的成员身份，可以使用类或具有属性方法，也可以使用具有属性方法。To verify role membership programmatically, you can use the class or the property with the method, or you can use the property with the method. 有关示例代码，用于以编程方式检查角色成员身份，请参阅本主题中的示例部分。For sample code that programmatically checks role membership, see the Example section in this topic. 类还使您可以创建和删除角色以及将用户添加到或从角色中删除用户。The class also enables you to create and delete roles and to add users to or remove users from roles. > [!NOTE] > 如果已配置应用程序以使用类，不能修改角色或角色成员身份。If you have configured your application to use the class, you cannot modify roles or role membership. 仅 classverifies 成员身份在 Windows 安全组。The classverifies membership in Windows security groups only. 在这种情况下，必须使用 Windows 用户帐户管理而不是 ASP.NET 角色可以创建和删除组以及管理组成员身份。In this case, you must use Windows user account management rather than ASP.NET roles to create and delete groups and manage group membership. 可以将角色信息存储在多个数据源。You can store role information in several data sources. - 可以使用类，以检索其角色信息基于 Windows 组的成员身份。You can use the class to retrieve role information based on membership in Windows groups. - 通过使用存储在 SQL Server 数据库角色信息类。You can store role information in a SQL Server database by using the class. - 如果有现有的角色信息，或者想要存储中的角色信息和从 Windows、 授权存储或 SQL Server 以外的数据源中检索角色信息，则可以通过创建类继承实现自定义角色提供程序抽象类。If you have existing role information, or want to store role information in and retrieve role information from a data source other than Windows, an Authorization Store, or SQL Server, you can implement a custom role provider by creating a class that inherits the abstract class. 有关详细信息，请参阅[实现角色提供程序](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/851671ce-bf9b-43f2-aba4-bc9d28b11c7d)。For more information, see [Implementing a Role Provider](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/851671ce-bf9b-43f2-aba4-bc9d28b11c7d). 如果用户的浏览器接受 cookie，您可以在用户的计算机上的 cookie 中存储为该用户的角色信息。If a user's browser accepts cookies, you can store role information for that user in a cookie on the user's computer. 对于每个页请求，ASP.NET 从 cookie 读取该用户的角色信息。On each page request, ASP.NET reads the role information for that user from the cookie. 这可以通过减少通信所需的数据源检索其角色信息的量来提高应用程序性能。This can improve application performance by reducing the amount of communication required with the data source to retrieve role information. 如果用户的角色信息太长，若要存储在一个 cookie，ASP.NET 将只是最近使用的角色信息存储在 cookie 中，并随后查找所需的数据源中的其他角色信息。If the role information for a user is too long to store in a cookie, ASP.NET stores just the most recently used role information in the cookie and then looks up additional role information in the data source as required. 如果用户的浏览器不支持 cookie，或者禁用了 cookie，角色信息不会缓存在 cookie 中。If the user's browser does not support cookies or cookies are disabled, role information is not cached in a cookie. 您可以提高可靠性的在 cookie 中缓存通过指定的角色名称属性配置 ASP.NET 角色时。You can improve the reliability of the role names cached in a cookie by specifying a property when you configure ASP.NET roles. 默认值是`All`，该加密 cookie 中的角色名称和验证的 cookie 内容不被更改。The default is `All`, which encrypts role names in the cookie and validates that the cookie contents have not been altered. ## Examples 下面的示例演示配置为使用 ASP.NET 成员资格和 ASP.NET 角色和要使用的应用程序的 Web.config 文件来存储 SQL Server 数据库中的成员资格和角色信息。The following example shows the Web.config file for an application configured to use both ASP.NET membership and ASP.NET roles and to use the to store membership and role information in a SQL Server database. 只有管理员角色中的用户允许访问应用程序和用户进行身份验证与窗体身份验证。Users are authenticated with forms authentication and only users in the Administrators role are allowed access to the application. ``` ``` 下面的代码示例以编程方式检查登录的用户是否属于管理员角色允许用户查看其他用户的角色之前。The following code example programmatically checks whether the logged-on user is in the Administrators role before allowing the user to view other users' roles.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法调用将指定的用户与数据源的指定角色关联的默认角色提供程序。The method calls the default role provider to associate the specified users with the specified role at the data source. 如果应用程序使用类，在调用期间执行数据库更新方法将在事务内完成。If your application uses the class, the database updates that are performed during the call to the method are made within a transaction. 如果遇到错误，如已在指定的角色的用户名，回滚事务并不执行任何更新。If an error is encountered, such as a user name that is already in a specified role, the transaction is rolled back and no updates are performed. > [!NOTE] > 用户名称和角色名称不能包含逗号。User names and role names cannot contain commas. ## Examples 下面的代码示例将一个或多个用户添加到角色，或从基于用户输入的角色中删除用户。The following code example adds one or more users to a role or removes a user from a role based on user input. 启用角色管理的 Web.config 文件的示例，请参阅。For an example of a Web.config file that enables role management, see . summary.span: 获取或设置要存储和检索其角色信息的应用程序的名称。

span.span: Gets or sets the name of the application to store and retrieve role information for.

value.span: 要存储和检索其角色信息的应用程序的名称。

span.span: The name of the application to store and retrieve role information for.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性由类，以将用户和角色与不同的应用程序相关联。The property is used by the class to associate users and roles with different applications. 这允许多个应用程序使用相同的数据源存储用户和角色信息，而不重复的用户名称或重复的角色名称之间发生冲突。This enables multiple applications to use the same data source to store user and role information without running into conflicts between duplicate user names or duplicate role names. 多个 ASP.NET 应用程序可以通过指定相同的值中使用相同的数据源属性。Multiple ASP.NET applications can use the same data source by specifying the same value in the property. 可以设置属性以编程方式，也可以设置它以声明方式在 Web 应用程序的配置文件中使用`applicationName`属性。You can set the property programmatically, or you can set it declaratively in the configuration file for the Web application by using the `applicationName` attribute. 如果使用 Web 应用程序类和一个值，没有为指定`applicationName`配置文件中的属性属性值为当前使用属性。If your Web application is using the class and a value is not specified for the `applicationName` attribute in the configuration file, the property value for the current property is used. > [!CAUTION] > 因为所有服务的请求使用单个默认角色提供程序实例对象，可以有多个请求同时执行，并尝试设置属性值。Because a single default role provider instance is used for all of the requests served by an object, you can have multiple requests executing concurrently and attempting to set the property value. 属性不是线程安全的多个写入操作，且不断变化属性值可能会导致多个用户的应用程序的意外行为。The property is not thread safe for multiple writes, and changing the property value can result in unexpected behavior for multiple users of an application. 应避免编写代码，以允许用户设置属性，除非有要求。You should avoid writing code to allow users to set the property, unless required. 应用程序的示例情况属性可能需要是管理应用程序，用于管理角色的多个应用程序的数据。An example of an application where setting the property may be required is an administrative application that manages role data for multiple applications. 此类应用程序应在单用户应用程序并不是 Web 应用程序。Such an application should be a single-user application and not a Web application. ## Examples 下面的示例演示中的元素`system.web`的 ASP.NET 应用程序的 Web.config 文件部分。The following example shows the element in the `system.web` section of the Web.config file for an ASP.NET application. 它指定应用程序使用实例并设置`applicationName`属性为`MyApplication`。It specifies that the application uses a instance and sets the `applicationName` attribute to `MyApplication`. ``` ```

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示当前用户的角色是否已缓存在某个 Cookie 中。

span.span: Gets a value indicating whether the current user's roles are cached in a cookie.

value.span: 如果当前用户的角色已缓存在某个 Cookie 中，则为 ；否则，为 。

span.span: if the current user's roles are cached in a cookie; otherwise, .

value.span: 默认值为 。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当属性设置为`true`在 Web.config 文件中，每个用户的角色信息存储在 cookie 中。When the property is set to `true` in the Web.config file, role information for each user is stored in a cookie. 当角色管理检查以确定用户是否属于特定角色时，角色 cookie 将检查之前的角色提供程序调用以检查数据源中的角色列表。When role management checks to see whether a user is in a particular role, the roles cookie is checked before the role provider is called to check the list of roles at the data source. Cookie 将动态更新来缓存最近已验证的角色名称。The cookie is dynamically updated to cache the most recently validated role names. 您可以提高可靠性的在 cookie 中缓存通过指定的角色名称属性配置 ASP.NET 角色时。You can improve the reliability of the role names cached in a cookie by specifying a property when you configure ASP.NET roles. 默认值是`All`，该加密 cookie 中的角色名称和验证的 cookie 内容不被更改。The default is `All`, which encrypts role names in the cookie and validates that the cookie contents have not been altered. > [!NOTE] > 因为除了数据源，可以缓存角色名称，就可以在数据源的角色管理的更改不会反映在缓存的值。Because role names can be cached apart from the data source, it is possible that changes to role management at the data source would not be reflected in the cached values. 在这种情况下，用户必须关闭并重新打开其浏览器清除缓存的 cookie 值。In this case, the user must close and re-open their browser to clear the cached cookie value. ## Examples 下面的示例演示中的元素`system.web`的 ASP.NET 应用程序的 Web.config 文件部分。The following example shows the element in the `system.web` section of the Web.config file for an ASP.NET application. 它指定应用程序使用实例并设置`cacheRolesInCookie`属性为`true`。It specifies that the application uses a instance and sets the `cacheRolesInCookie` attribute to `true`. ``` ```

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性使您能够直接引用应用程序的默认角色提供程序。The property enables you to directly reference the default role provider for an application. 这常用于访问不属于的自定义成员的角色提供程序的一部分抽象类。This is commonly used to access custom members of the role provider that are not part of the abstract class. 例如，类包括的重载方法，可用于确定用户是否是常见的 Windows 角色中使用枚举值。For example, the class includes an overload of the method that enables you to determine whether a user is in a common Windows role by using a enumeration value. 对引用类的应用程序可以通过使用来获取属性并且可以强制转换为为了引用的重载。A reference to the class for an application can be obtained by using the property and can be cast as a in order to refer to the overload. 如果为应用程序配置了多个角色提供程序，则可以访问不同的角色提供程序使用集合。If multiple role providers are configured for an application, you can access different role providers using the collection. ## Examples 下面的代码示例将强制转换为的默认角色提供程序和检查当前登录的用户是否为管理员角色允许用户查看应用程序的角色设置之前。The following code example casts the default role provider as a and checks whether the currently logged-on user is in the Administrators role before allowing the user to view roles settings for the application. 启用角色管理的 Web.config 文件的示例，请参阅。For an example of a Web.config file that enables role management, see . remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法调用来从数据源的指定角色中删除指定的用户的默认角色提供程序。The method calls the default role provider to remove the specified users from the specified role at the data source. 如果应用程序使用类，在调用期间执行数据库更新方法将在事务内完成。If the application uses the class, the database updates that are performed during the call to the method are made within a transaction. 如果遇到错误，例如不属于指定角色的用户名称，请在事务将回滚并不执行任何更新。If an error is encountered, such as a user name that is not in a specified role, the transaction is rolled back and no updates are performed. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用方法以从角色中删除一个或多个用户。The following code example uses the method to remove one or more users from a role. 启用角色管理的 Web.config 文件的示例，请参阅。For an example of a Web.config file that enables role management, see . remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法调用`RoleExists`方法来确定角色名称是否存在该应用程序中指定的数据源中的默认角色提供程序属性。The method calls the `RoleExists` method of the default role provider to determine whether a role name exists in the data source for the application that is specified in the property. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用方法来确定角色名称是否已存在之前创建该角色。The following code example uses the method to determine whether a role name already exists before creating the role. 启用角色管理的 Web.config 文件的示例，请参阅。For an example of a Web.config file that enables role management, see . > [!IMPORTANT] > 此示例包含一个文本框，用于接受用户输入，这是一个潜在的安全威胁。This example contains a text box that accepts user input, which is a potential security threat. 默认情况下，ASP.NET 网页验证用户输入是否不包含脚本或 HTML 元素。By default, ASP.NET Web pages validate that user input does not include script or HTML elements. 有关详细信息，请参阅[脚本侵入概述](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/772c7312-211a-4eb3-8d6e-eec0aa1dcc07)。For more information, see [Script Exploits Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/772c7312-211a-4eb3-8d6e-eec0aa1dcc07).
